PREFACE The most famous and enduring of [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's works , [most readers]247-most readers will agree , is [OGBOJU ODE NINU IGBO IRUNMALE]8-ogboju ode ninu igbo irunmale , which [I]0-i translated nearly fifty years ago as [The Forest of [a Thousand Daemons]249-a thousand daemons]248-the forest of a thousand daemons . At that time , [I]0-i had resolved to translate nothing less than ALL of [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's novels and other writings , in order to make them accessible to [non - Yoruba readers both within and outside [the African continent]251-the african continent]250-non - yoruba readers both within and outside the african continent . Based on [my]0-i translation , there have been others into [Italian]9-italian and French . That raises the obvious question - why has it taken [me]0-i nearly half a century to translate another of [his]100-fagunwa works ? Afterall , the resolve - and challenge - continued to hover round the lining of [my]0-i skull , in between [my]0-i own literary and other preoccupations . Indeed , together with [[my]0-i then publisher]252-my then publisher , [the late Rex Collings]101-the late rex collings , [I]0-i did make another move to obtain further translation rights from [[his]100-fagunwa literary executors]253-his literary executors - [I]0-i am no longer certain which work was to have been [my]0-i next victim . [His]100-fagunwa estate however created some difficulties , not really insurmountable , nothing [we]254-we could not have overcome with some will from [my]0-i side but - truth will out ! - [my]0-i heart was not fully in it , and [I]0-i gladly seized on that excuse to withdraw from the project . The real inhibiting factor for [me]0-i however was , and still is - [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa is not [an easy writer to translate]255-an easy writer to translate ! When [I]0-i set out to

IN [THE FOREST]10-the forest OF [OLODUMARE]11-olodumare subdue the OGBOJU ODE with [my]0-i self - assured literary armoury , it was to be a labour of love , a tribute to [a writer on whose verbal pyrotechnics [my]0-i generation]256-a writer on whose verbal pyrotechnics my generation had been weaned , [one who had also filled [our]254-we youth with unforgettable characters]257-one who had also filled our youth with unforgettable characters - [Ogongo Baba Eiye]102-ogongo baba eiye , [Aramanda Okunrin]103-aramanda okunrin , ( [the Wonder - Man of Contrary Sensations )]258-the wonder - man of contrary sensations ) , [Kako Onikumo Ekun]104-kako onikumo ekun and [[his]100-fagunwa tragic wife]259-his tragic wife â pa mi [nku s'ori bembe s'oko]105-nku s'ori bembe s'oko , iyawo [Kako]104-kako onikumo ekun â such unforgettable musicality , yet an extract from a blood - chilling denouement ! 1 had even named [[my]0-i first child]260-my first child [Imodoye]106-imodoye , largely from sheer pleasure in the mellifluous name , so deftly married to the mind 's natural pursuit - Knowledge becomes understanding/ wisdom . [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa was thus , in [my]0-i regard , [â  extended family]261-â  extended family . 1 thought [1]0-i could undertake the translation of [his]100-fagunwa works sleep - walking , one hand tied behind [my]0-i back , the other cradling a frothing calabash of palm - wine ! Perhaps in between walks in [the forest]262-the forest , that home of imagination and intuition , incubator of a strange , possibly pre - natal , certainly instinctual affinity to the mysterious in Nature that [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's works only served to accentuate within [me]0-i from childhood . Well , [I]0-i learnt the hard way . After the unexpectedly taxing experience of struggling through that text , [I]0-i came to the conclusion that 1 had better attend to [my]0-i own writing - at least for some time - before attempting to tackle another product of [that master of the Yoruba language]263-that master of the yoruba language ! As can be guessed from the foregoing , [I]0-i had become immersed in [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's works at a young age , and [I]0-i know that [I]0-i

PREFACE find [myself]0-i in [good company]264-good company when [I]0-i saythat [I]0-i still find [OGBOJU]107-ogboju ODE the truest expression of [his]100-fagunwa creative originality and inspiration . [His]100-fagunwa other works , including this , are over sententious , too preachy , overloaded with moralizing , much of it repetitious . The reasons for this tendency however , are worth acknowledging , it is useful to remind [ourselves]265-ourselves , from time to time , of the educational environment that was the genesis of such works - including the early stage works of [the itinerant theatre companies that occasionally relieved the tedium of the performance menu of [missionary schools]267-missionary schools]266-the itinerant theatre companies that occasionally relieved the tedium of the performance menu of missionary schools , arpong [them]266-the itinerant theatre companies that occasionally relieved the tedium of the performance menu of missionary schools the eclectic dramaturgy of [Hubert Ogunde]12-hubert ogunde biblical resources , anti - colonial agitprop , history , Christian morality tales , etc . etc . [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa was a product of that remarkable phase in African socio - cultural transition . [Ours]265-ourselves has been , from time immemorial , [a densely mythological culture]268-a densely mythological culture . [That cultural]269-that cultural source now found itself bombarded by the creative resources and values of another , and in a most imperious way . The Yoruba cosmological givens - with [their]270-their educed moralities- had become entangled in [others]271-others ' confident explications of human existence and purpose , transmitted , most penetratingly , through incoming religious literature and iconic representations - and by iconic , [I]273-those at the receiving end , but of a creative / nationalist bent refer to pittorial representations of [saints]3235-saints , angels , demons , [heroes]3236-heroes both historic and fictional , [kings]3237-kings and [queens]3238-queens , and even folkloric figures in [children]3239-children 's narratives - [fairies]3240-fairies , gnomes , elves , [witches]3241-witches , [goblins]3242-goblins . [Jack]108-jack and [the Bean Stalk]109-the bean stalk , [Cinderella]3243-cinderella , [Pied Piper of [Hamelin]14-hamelin]3244-pied piper of hamelin , [Tom Thumb]110-tom thumb , [Sleeping Beauty]111-sleeping beauty , [Alice]112-alice in Wonderland ,[273-those at the receiving end , but of a creative / nationalist bent]

IN [THE FOREST OF OLODUMARE]272-the forest of olodumare etc . etc . Such fictional mixed baggage of exoticism and ethical intent permeated virtually every facet of literary encounters , and was extremely seductive for its time . For [those at the receiving end , but of a creative / nationalist bent]273-those at the receiving end , but of a creative / nationalist bent , a new nourishment , a retrieval and recasting of lost indigenous images and symbols , including the spiritual , had to be undertaken . The external - in this case , largely Christian - frames of reference could not be abandoned , least of all that ' puritanic '[100-fagunwa] ethic that frowned on the sheer pleasure of the imagination without an accompanying moral extract . Fiction had to be grounded in moral purpose , otherwise , it was yet another distraction game of the devil . Such was the background material of [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's literary and religious education . Fortunately however , [he]100-fagunwa also drew inspiration from archetypes in the literature of the Quest - which is common to [nearly all cultures [we]275-we know of]274-nearly all cultures we know of ; [man in search the very meaning of existence]276-man in search the very meaning of existence , [man in search of wisdom]277-man in search of wisdom , [man in search of salvation]278-man in search of salvation - personal or communal - [man in search of the philosopher]279-man in search of the philosopher 's stone that held the key to all existential conundrums , but also - [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa does not frown on the materialist - the beckoning and/or deserving of fathomless riches . The moral purpose however earths all outings . [Each protagonist of [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa]280-each protagonist of fagunwa 's novels- Akara - ogun , [Irinkerindo]113-irinkerindo , etc . became localized variations on the theme of the pilgrim , [Yoruba John Bunyans of PILGRIM]281-yoruba john bunyans of pilgrim 'S PROGRESS , with some coloration of co - opted incidents from other literature of The Quest including the Greek classics . A close reading also reveals[114-preface]

[PREFACE]114-preface indebtedness to the travails of deities from [the Yoruba pantheon]282-the yoruba pantheon , especially of [Orunmila]115-orunmila and [Obatala]116-obatala whose odysseys were never without rewards in the acquisition of knowledge arid wisdom , with stressing situations that brought out such vjrtues as patience , stoicism , and magnanimity of spirit . [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa was quite open about [his]100-fagunwa mission to impart these virtues to [humanity]283-humanity . [[His]100-fagunwa protagonists]284-his protagonists - or else [the figures e'bcountered in [their]284-his protagonists adventures]285-the figures e'bcountered in their adventures â have a constant message for [the black race]286-the black race . That message was invariably bound in ethical precepts - this is what accounts for the compulsive evangelist in;D,0 . [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa , a persona that all too often overwhelmed the other half - the expansive raconteur . [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's literary [Muse]117-muse is perhaps best understood through the eponymous name of [one of [[his]100-fagunwa most dignified characters]288-his most dignified characters]287-one of his most dignified characters - the earlier named [Imodoye]106-imodoye - [a Muse that taxes those [she]287-one of his most dignified characters possesses with the mission of improving the moral outlook of [[his]100-fagunwa fellow men]290-his fellow men and [women]291-women , of imbuing [the black race]286-the black race with a sense of destiny]289-a muse that taxes those she possesses with the mission of improving the moral outlook of his fellow men and women , of imbuing the black race with a sense of destiny . Unlike [some of [[society]294-society 's loud political mouthers]295-society 's loud political mouthers]293-some of society 's loud political mouthers , [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa was the genuine article , [a ' social critic]3245-a ' social critic '[3245-a ' social critic] before the expression became current , resentful of the warping of traditional mores , the rise of [a mimic bourgeoisie with warped values , the confusion in the minds of the nouveaux - riches]296-a mimic bourgeoisie with warped values , the confusion in the minds of the nouveaux - riches . This made [his]100-fagunwa moralizing somewhat ambiguous , since [he]100-fagunwa was clearly not averse from extolling the goals ( material success ) of [that class]297-that class , as a mission worth pursuing in its own right . The reward of each successful a / dventure appeared to be wealth , infinite riches . Underlying

IN [THE FOREST OF [OLODUMARE Fagunwa]100-fagunwa]15-the forest of olodumare fagunwa 's purpose however was the impulse to re - interpret , augment , and hopefully reconcile the antecedent world of traditional values of [[his]100-fagunwa Yoruba world]298-his yoruba world with Christian teachings traditional values such as respect of [wives]299-wives for [[their]299-wives husbands]300-their husbands , of [children]3239-children for [[their]3239-children parents]302-their parents , [pupils]303-pupils for [[their]303-pupils teachers]304-their teachers , [the individual]305-the individual for [the community]306-the community . Nearly every encounter , every episode in [[his]100-fagunwa protagonists]284-his protagonists ' adventures is tuned to the cadences of such value extraction , if not in the action itself , then in the depiction of one character or another , sometimes simply through the strategy of character contrasts . Well , so much for a reminder of what [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa tried to achieve through [his]100-fagunwa riveting tales of encounters with [the iwin , ebora , anjonnu , and other forms of abami eda]3246-the iwin , ebora , anjonnu , and other forms of abami eda , for whom 1 invented the generic word '[284-his protagonists] ghommid ' in [my]284-his protagonists translation of OGBOJU ODE , a neologism that [I]284-his protagonists have also carried into [IGBO OLODUMARE]16-igbo olodumare , in order to preserve some continuity . Faced with the same problem as [I]284-his protagonists was when [he]100-fagunwa undertook the translation of [IRINKERINDO NINU IGBO ELEGBEJE]113-irinkerindo rendered as EXPEDITION TO [THE MOUNTAIN OF THOUGHT]3247-the mountain of thought - another labour of love to which [1]284-his protagonists am delighted to draw attention - [Dapo Adeniyi]118-dapo adeniyi , [1]3248-1 was gratified to note , has also adopted the tradition of what [I]284-his protagonists called '[284-his protagonists] inventive naming ceremonies ' in order to find English equivalents for [the inhabitants of [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa]3249-the inhabitants of fagunwa 's physical universe , most of whom are unknown to the English and other languages . â¢ . u- u i [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's relevance continues in a manner in which , feel certain , even [he]100-fagunwa had never directly intended . Trapped[284-his protagonists]

n PREFACE within a modem , [urban environment]308-urban environment - at least one that passes for such - [one]309-one is moved to ask whether the creatures [we]310-we encounter today , most especially in [the rarefied zones of power]311-the rarefied zones of power [, charged with governance , administration , business , ^ ^^dsnimunity security , education]312-, charged with governance , administration , business , ^ ^^dsnimunity security , education , etc . etc . are representatives of the upward evolution of [social man]313-social man , or are closer to [the dwellers of [llu obun]17-llu obun]314-the dwellers of llu obun - ( [City of Filth]315-city of filth ) both moral and physical - wJth unprepossessing , often sadistic or retarded characters such 9S [the Agbako]119-the agbako , [Ijamba]216-ijamba , [Ojola - ibinu]120-ojola - ibinu , [Dongisola]121-dongisola , [Ibanuje- isale]122-ibanuje- isale , etc . of [his]316-his creations . Indeed , the question that confronts [us]310-we today is whether or not [[Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's protagonists]317-fagunwa 's protagonists such as [Akana - ogun]123-akana - ogun , [Olowo - aiye]124-olowo - aiye , Imodoye , etc . would not find [themselves]317-fagunwa 's protagonists even more imperiled in today [s supposedly developed and modernized Nigerian cities]318-s supposedly developed and modernized nigerian cities than in [those forests of animal and supernatural violence]319-those forests of animal and supernatural violence , spiritual void and evil e'mt)odiments into which [he]316-his cast [[his]316-his heroes]320-his heroes for [their]320-his heroes life - and- death struggles , deploying each conflict to inject in [[his]316-his readers]321-his readers a , longingfor a modicum of morality , decency , rational dealing , moderation , selflessness and sense of community . " ' In short , in looking at society today , can [one]309-one fail to see correlations with [[Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's fantasy world]3251-fagunwa 's fantasy world , and to such an i extent that [one]309-one is moved to ask : which is [the Jungle]3253-the jungle , and which * isthe human habitation ? As one who roamsthe forests quite a bit [myself]316-his , cocooned therapeutically in the tranquility and order of Nature , its intrinsic laws and logic of renewal , [I]316-his am often - moved to ask : which one signifies progress and which the[316-his]

IN [THE FOREST OF]10-the forest [OLODUMARE]11-olodumare State of raw primitivism of the most dispiriting retrogression ? Yes , predatoriness is also a law of [the jungle]3253-the jungle , but it is a predatory pattern that is organic to the principle of sustenance and replacement , decay and renewal , not material lust that today expresses itself in kidnapping [innocents]323-innocents - incloding [school children]324-school children and [octogenarians]325-octogenarians - for ransom . [Animals]125-animals kill only for food . Among [supposedly cultivated humanoids]326-supposedly cultivated humanoids , contentment is not even found in ' making a killing '[100-fagunwa] on the market in frenzied accumulation ' , but literally , kidnapping and butchering [[their]320-his heroes victims]3254-their victims for [their]3254-their victims '[100-fagunwa] vital organs ' as essential for money making rituals and pursuit of political power . The jungle law of supply and demand has become so diversified that miniÂ­ markets exist that specialize in the sale of human spare parts . [The clientele]3255-the clientele include [supposedly educated men]3256-supposedly educated men and [women]291-women , yet so mentally regressed that [they]3255-the clientele believe that a spoonful of powdered human liver or thumb , mixed with [their]3255-the clientele akamu , is certain to make [them]3255-the clientele millionaires between one market day and the next or guarantee [their]3255-the clientele party nomination for governorship or a senate seat . Do [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's markets of sinister commodities located in [forests of primordial evil]3258-forests of primordial evil appear out of [this world]3259-this world ? At least [they]3255-the clientele do not pretend to be [churches]3260-churches , [mosques]3261-mosques or shrines or [places of spiritual gathering]3262-places of spiritual gathering into which [[our]3263-our adventurers]3264-our adventurers can be lured in a false sense of security , in today 's real life , there appears to be no space left that is honoured as a place of universal sanctuary . [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's literature may be heavy on moralizations , but the creations with which [he]100-fagunwa has '[100-fagunwa] peopled ' [[his]100-fagunwa forested universe]3265-his forested universe provoke some human and social[100-fagunwa]

PREFACE paradigms that question the entire theory of the upward evolution of [the human race]327-the human race - or , in fairness to [others]271-others - specifically of [its local representatives]329-its local representatives , and of present times . ^ , Yes , [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa literally bludgeons [[his]100-fagunwa readers]321-his readers with moral pfecepts , oppressive and self - indulgent but , can one truthfully acfcuse [him]100-fagunwa of failing to have extracted those moralities , or the lack of them , from social observations , some of which are , as earlier admitted , disturbingly immediate ? Unrelieved negative portrayals tend to blunt the edge of credulity , the result of flat , two - dimensional fictional representations , like [souls of pitch darkness without even the occasional glimmer of light]331-souls of pitch darkness without even the occasional glimmer of light . And yet , and yet ... can [one]309-one truthfully swear to never having met , in one 's own social interactions , [beings that appear to be accurate reifications of the basest depravities]333-beings that appear to be accurate reifications of the basest depravities ? 1 confess [myself]0-i to have been startled , arrested in mid - stride on arrival at certain passages during [my]0-i translation of [IGBO OLODUMARE-]126-igbo olodumare- it was as if [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa had been looking into the future , cautioning against the dangers to society through political carelessness that results in malevolent occupation of leadership positions . PREFACE The moral ambiguities posed by [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa are even more troubling , and nowhere is this more openly demonstrated than in the very trajectory of [Olowo - aiye]124-olowo - aiye , both [narrator]403-narrator and [hero of [our]400-we story]404-hero of our story . Even the name by itself spells not only approval of , but outright celebration of wealth , materialism , a shade of ostentation that is further sealed by the outcome of [the hero]405-the hero 's adventures - unlimited , inexhaustible wealth , thanks to the discovery of the magic egg within the stomach of [Ojola]120-ojola - ibinu - ibinu who , slain after one of the bloodiest battles that have emerged from the pen of [the master of Yoruba narrative]406-the master of yoruba narrative . It is not suffjcient to claim that the ' egg of plenty '[408-the extpller of virtues] is the goal and/or reward at the end of the ' Quest '[408-the extpller of virtues] epic across many cultures . It is dimply that [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa is nothing if not [the great moralist]407-the great moralist , [the extpller of virtues]408-the extpller of virtues and [chastiser of vanities]409-chastiser of vanities . Greed , avarice , lust for material things , all come under [his]100-fagunwa stern , often repetitious disapprobation , yet time and time again , it is evident that the stressing of the human spirit takes second place , and indeed serves as mere prelude to prosperity . The matter is stranger still when one comes to the past and present conduct of both [the principal figures of the Quest]410-the principal figures of the quest and [[their]410-the principal figures of the quest associates]411-their associates . The case of [Ajediran]130-ajediran , [the lovely consort of [[our]400-we main protagonist]413-our main protagonist , [Olowo - aiye]124-olowo - aiye]412-the lovely consort of our main protagonist , olowo - aiye , strikes [one]309-one with fearsome force . This is [her]130-ajediran own autobiography , straight from [her]130-ajediran own mouth , and [[her]130-ajediran sister]415-her sister 's ; [We]400-we moved out to seek those very witchcraft powers and [we]400-we succeeded , and in that mood did [we]400-we begin [our]400-we career

IN THE FOREST OF OLODUMARE of witchery that has endured till today ... Listen , [man of courage]416-man of courage , when [[my]0-i sister]417-my sister and [I]0-i became [witches]3241-witches , [we]400-we dipped the eyes of [people]419-people in adversity . Does [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa , even by mere suggestion , cast a censorious eye on [Ajediran]130-ajediran 's past ? Thus did [the people]3281-the people foist on [[my]429-no such witches sister]417-my sister and 1 a name that [we]430-we did not deserve .[429-no such witches]

PREFACE Here [we]430-we discern [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's comparative moral voice : a disgust with [community]431-community 's lazy moralities which fasten on mere rumour in order to rush to negative , injurious Judgment , the consequence of which is to turn [the innocent and upright]432-the innocent and upright into [vengeful monsters]433-vengeful monsters . No question whatsoever , [many victims of such injustice]434-many victims of such injustice will look on [the two sisters]435-the two sisters with some understanding , even if [they]434-many victims of such injustice do not condone [their]434-many victims of such injustice subsequent career of vengeance . [People]419-people deserve whatever comes to [them]419-people when [they]419-people initiate a project of calumny - thus implies [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa - and responsibility for the misconduct of [the falsely accused]437-the falsely accused is placed squarely on [slanderers]438-slanderers , not on [the victim]439-the victim turned [avenger]440-avenger . [[Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's target]441-fagunwa 's target , let [us]430-we remember , is constantly - [the community]306-the community , its failings and path to redemption . In this case , [he]100-fagunwa targets the corrosive power of [mere gossip]443-mere gossip , its ability to undermine society and reduce the collective intelligence of [[its]306-the community members]444-its members . When [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa focuses on [individuals]445-individuals , [he]100-fagunwa writes of [them]445-individuals in an archetypal or representative framework , rendered most elaborately and summatively in that sermonic scene of [j [Hell]22-hell 's inhabitants]22-hell where [Iku]128-iku [himself]128-iku plays [tourist guide]446-tourist guide , taking [I]0-i [[our]430-we hero]447-our hero through the illustrious careers of [[his]128-iku unwilling guests]448-his unwilling guests , nowundertorture . A footnote on that guided tour of [[Iku]128-iku 's torture chamber]449-iku 's torture chamber sums up [Fagunwa]100-fagunwa 's humanistic signature . Having piled on the horrors - depicted as no more than just deserts - and overwhelmed the tolerance level of humane sensibilities , [he]100-fagunwa then recoils , using [Olowo - aiye]124-olowo - aiye as the touchstone of a humane [I]0-i response . It is interesting that this is the scene in which an

IN [THE FOREST OF OLODUMARE]272-the forest of olodumare element of comic confrontation - between [Olowo - aiye]124-olowo - aiye and [[his]124-olowo - aiye ponderous host]451-his ponderous host [Onirugbon - yeuke]131-onirugbon - yeuke - is actually played up . ENTER [OLOWO - AIYE]145-olowo - aiye Ofie bright afternoon a long while past , after [I]0-i had lunched , [I]0-i left [[my]0-i home]461-my home , strolled outside the fence of [[my]0-i compound]462-my compound and climbed on a huge rock . For [I]0-i needed some reflection at this time and did not wish any interruption . For a time of play deserves its space , a timeTor fighting is meant for fighting , the time for weeping is

when [one]309-one weeps , the time for rejoicing calls for rejoicing . ' Ah , [[my]484-my father friend]3303-my friend , raise [your]484-my father eyes , conversation resides in human eyes , [the Lord of [Heavens]162-heavens]3362-the lord of heavens is mighty as [a King]3627-a king . ' Thus went the inscription on the outer face of the wall of [this house]3721-this house and remains there till this day . However , it is sad to relate that [the new Gatekeeper]3722-the new gatekeeper did not long remain in [his]3722-the new gatekeeper position , for even as things transpire among [humans]701-humans , so do [they]701-humans among ghommids . ' On [[my]484-my father father]484-my father 's wedding day , [the entirety of [the forest]262-the forest]3808-the entirety of the forest was encircled by unrestrained jollification . '[0-i] [I]0-i had not walked that much when [I]0-i arrived at [a part of [Igbo Olodumare]16-igbo olodumare]1444-a part of igbo olodumare which astonished [me]0-i greatly , for it was there [I]0-i encountered trees which had no roots , yet they stood rigid and , their leaves were a deep glossy green . The animals spoke the language of [humans]701-humans , so did the birds . [I]0-i looked for game in this bush but found nothing whatsoever . [I]0-i saw neither mammal nor bird , not even a squirrel sprinted up a tree in [my]0-i presence . 1 walked and walked , and encountered no living thing . After a while , a breeze got up , the tops of these trees

IN [THE FOREST OF [OLODUMARE]11-olodumare]272-the forest of olodumare began to bow all the way to the ground , the very tips touched ground and rose again . The wind was powerful , it blew hither and thither , and both trees and buttresses began to collide with [one another]658-one another . It was a severe commotion . Without [God]129-god 's mercies , a careless tree trunk would have made [me]0-i a casualty- [God]129-god is indeed mighty . After a while , when one of the taller trees took the tuft of its head to the ground close by [me]0-i , [I]0-i quickly sat [myself]0-i on it before it rose , so that when the wind got up again and the tree righted itself , it was both the tree and [myself]0-i that sprang up . The tree wps tall , if [someone]1178-someone spied [me]0-i from the ground , [I]0-i would appear to be little bigger than a gnat . [I]0-i was most delighted when [I]0-i ascended to the skies because [I]0-i could see the environment most clearly : all the leaves were deep green and the view was most entrancing . It took quite a while for [me]0-i to realize that instead of rejoicing , [I]0-i should in fact have been lamenting . For after [I]0-i had been catapulted up , the wind fell , trees remained in their normal positions , no longer bowing to the ground - if only [I]0-i had known , [I]0-i would have leapt to the ground while the wind was active , but now that everything was still , [I]0-i was confronted with a serious problem . [I]0-i could not leap down from such a height , if [I]0-i tried it , certain it was that both arms and legs would be broken into little pieces . And the tree was too high , [its]1449-its trunk so smooth that [no one]3448-no one could dream of descending it on [his]3448-no one own . This now sent [me]0-i into deep cogitation , [I]0-i began to rue [my]0-i action,-wondering how [I]0-i could

THE ELEPHANT HUNTER IS LOST IN [THE FOREST OF OLODUMARE]25-the forest of olodumare : GONGO SO ! have yielded to such a foolish impulse . Wrapped in these thoughts , [I]0-i saw [a duiker passing by]1451-a duiker passing by and [I]0-i hailed [him]1451-a duiker passing by . ' Ah , [Mr. Duiker]179-mr. duiker , kindly rescue [me]1451-a duiker passing by from this constraint . It was the tree that lowered itself to the ground before [I]1451-a duiker passing by sat on its top branches . Then the wind got up again and with it , the tree , which is how [you]3899-you come to find [me]1451-a duiker passing by seated gingerly at the top . May [God Almighty]129-god save [you]3899-you from imprisonment in broad daylight , [the Owner of the Day]3900-the owner of the day will save [you]3899-you from the dangers that come from the hunger of the throat . [[My]1451-a duiker passing by dear duiker]3901-my dear duiker , [you]3899-you hold an important ranking among [the anim'^ls of [the forest]262-the forest]3902-the anim'^ls of the forest , for [you]3899-you are found both white and red , [your]3899-you limbs are sturdy , and [your]3899-you head boasts flaring horns . [The farmer who fails to honour [you]3899-you]3904-the farmer who fails to honour you will experience the dearth of yams , [the farm owner who accounts [you]3899-you nothing]3905-the farm owner who accounts you nothing will continue to labour in vain . With all these in mind , [I]1451-a duiker passing by implore [you]3899-you in the name of [the King of [Heaven]43-heaven]3317-the king of heaven not to fail to try and extricate [me]1451-a duiker passing by from [my]1451-a duiker passing by plight , so [I]1451-a duiker passing by can take leave of [this place where [I]1451-a duiker passing by am presehtly stuck]3907-this place where i am presehtly stuck . IN [THE FOREST OF OLODUMARE]25-the forest of olodumare was lodged , awaitingthe violent wind of which the bush rat had warned [me]0-i . [i]0-i remained thus , between earth and sky until [my]0-i own tree completed its obeisance , and began its journey back . So when [my]0-i tree bowed a second time , [i]0-i was ready ; the moment it touched ground , [I]0-i leapt off before it could begin [its]1534-its return journey . [THE ELEPHANT HUNTER]1393-the elephant hunter IS LOST IN [THE FOREST OF [OLODUMARE]11-olodumare]25-the forest of olodumare : CONGO SOI As [I]0-i wandered around [the forest]262-the forest , [I]0-i found numerous E snails , their shells served as containers for water -1 lined them up in an orderly fashion in [[my]0-i cave]1557-my cave . About the eighth month of [my]0-i sojourn in [this forest]3335-this forest , a I heavy wind arose . It was a heavy storm and much of the sky was littered with flying debris . As [I]0-i surveyed the cloud of objects , [I]0-i noticed [a corn cob]1559-a corn cob . [I]0-i began to follow it with [my]0-i eyes to see where it would land . [I]0-i gave chase to the cob until its progress was stopped and it rested against a tangled growth on [the river]486-the river - it was there that [I]0-i reached out and grabbed it . ' After which , [I]0-i took the cob with [me]0-i into [[my]0-i cave]1557-my cave and slept .[0-i]

IN [THE FOREST OF [OLODUMARE]11-olodumare]25-the forest of olodumare At daybreak , it was as if even though [my]0-i spirit had slept , [my]0-i mind had not , it had been kept occupied by the corn , for even so does a problem on which [we]1564-we cogitate find its solution when one has slept a little and the mind has rested . The moment [I]0-i woke , [my]0-i mind informed [me]0-i that [I]0-i should clear [a little land]1565-a little land and plant the seedling . [I]0-i wasted no time in carrying this out . After a while , the seed germinated . As if playing its own game , it grew and matured , eventually producing two hefty ears of corn . When they had ripened , [I]0-i did not eat them but kept them till they had dried â and the two ears were truly bursting with grain . When the rainy season returned , [I]0-i planted all the seeds on [the farm]720-the farm [I]0-i had by now enlarged and the seeds all fructified . [I]0-i began to feast on them . '[1810-the second] [The second]1810-the second departed [the world]352-the world before it was the hour apportioned [him]1810-the second by [Edumare]189-edumare . ' [The fifth]1818-the fifth was one who ruined [his]1818-the fifth life by [his]1818-the fifth unconcern . All that happened to [him]1818-the fifth was to merely stub [his]1818-the fifth toe . In the end , all kinds of ailments began to assail [this man]357-this man , each illness pulling another in its wake but all owing their origin to that tiny bug . All kinds of parasites took the same route into [his]357-this man head . [His]357-this man brain was infected , it lost its compass and [the man]538-the man became insane . THE THIRD DAY WITH BABA [ONIRUNGBON]72-onirungbon - [YEUKE]132-baba onirungbon - yeuke , WHO LIVES ON [THE ROCK PROMONTORY]27-the rock promontory [I]0-i could not sleep till dawn the following day , only once did [my]0-i eyes close . 1 had terrible dreams , [I]0-i saw a vicious spirit in [my]0-i dreams who began to pursue [me]0-i all over [the place]711-the place . As [I]0-i fled from pillar to post trying to escape [him]2014-him , [I]0-i ran into a snake whose fangs were like a lion 's , and when [I]0-i again fled from this , ran into a beast that was not particularly big but resembled more [a man with elongated talons]2015-a man with elongated talons - it glared at [me]0-i . This woke [me]0-i up . When [I]0-i woke , [I]0-i was panting heavily as if [I]0-i was on [a sprint field]2016-a sprint field , [my]0-i heart pounding like the engine of [an airplane]2017-an airplane . THE THIRD DAY WITH [BABA ONIRUNGBON - YEUKE]132-baba onirungbon - yeuke , [WHO LIVES]2139-who lives ON [THE ROCK PROMONTORY]1786-the rock promontory and [[his]538-the man wife]492-his wife only a waist slip , a time when the entire money in [his]538-the man possession never amounted to threepence , when [he]538-the man could not sleep for contemplation of [his]538-the man plight , [his]538-the man mind never at ease , when [his]538-the man food was pitiable and [his]538-the man body emaciated as a broomstick . '[538-the man] The moment [he]538-the man concluded [his]538-the man speech , [he]538-the man fell down , and died . ' [[My]538-the man good friend]702-my good friend , the moment [the man]538-the man drew [his]538-the man last breath , [they]4423-they seized [the woman]425-the woman , and hanged [her]425-the woman from a tree . '[538-the man] This is the nature of [the world]352-the world , [dear friend]2143-dear friend . THE THIRD DAY WITH [BABA ONIRUNGBON - YEUKE]132-baba onirungbon - yeuke , WHO LIVES ON [THE ROCK PROMONTORY places]2269-the rock promontory places . ' [God]196-god loved [humanity]283-humanity . So when [Asoju]206-asoju returned to [heaven]361-heaven and reported that [earth dwellers]4516-earth dwellers were in a state of discontent , [he]196-god sent [him]206-asoju back to ask of [everyone]4038-everyone what [they]4516-earth dwellers truly desired , so that [he]206-asoju could fulfill [their]4516-earth dwellers wishes . IN [THE FOREST OF [OLODUMARE]206-asoju]272-the forest of olodumare severely wounded but the hands of [the assailants]2365-the assailants did not quite snuff [him]206-asoju out . THE BOA - OF - FURY , KING OF ALL [THE WORLD]73-the world 'S REPTILES W hen [we]2862-we entered [the city]4897-the city proper , something of note occurred . When [Boa - of - Fury]233-boa - of - fury slithered out in the morning for [his]220-ewedaiyepo bath and felt a cut from the first machete , [he]220-ewedaiyepo would instinctively race faster , while the blades would continue to slice [his]220-ewedaiyepo underbeliy in ribbons , spilling out [his]220-ewedaiyepo guts . [This monster of a creature]4942-this monster of a creature began to writhe , but the more [he]220-ewedaiyepo did , the more [his]220-ewedaiyepo intestines piled out , reddening the ground with [his]220-ewedaiyepo blood , and confusion fell among the reptiles .[233-boa - of - fury]

IN [THE FOREST]10-the forest OF [OLODUMARE]233-boa - of - fury Before [Boa - of - Fury]233-boa - of - fury expired , [he]233-boa - of - fury understood whose handiwork this was and [he]233-boa - of - fury proclaimed [us]2984-we into [heaven]361-heaven with horrendous cries : ' [Human breed]4943-human breed ! Let [him]233-boa - of - fury bring harmony into the midst of [co - wives]3225-co - wives , provide [farmers]467-farmers with [fecund soil]3227-fecund soil , blissful work to [those who engage in other forms of labour]3228-those who engage in other forms of labour , give health to [the sick]2398-the sick , bestow wisdom on [kings]3237-kings , understanding to [nobles]4957-nobles , knowledge to [school children]324-school children , may [He]233-boa - of - fury take care of [[their]324-school children teachers]304-their teachers , and guide [the powerful]3357-the powerful onto the path of truthfulness . Good - bye for now . [D.O. Fagunwa]246-d.o. fagunwa
